page.title: 08MIXED FARMING
page.content: Farming; Almost all of the land in this area is given over to farming. The areas of rough grassland are used for sheep and during the summer the drier parts of the wet land is used for grazing. Most of the farming is of a mixed type and livestock are kept and crops are grown on most farms. Only one farm is almost exclusively given over to dairy farming with a large herd of Friesian cows. Cattle are bred, fattened and sent to market. Various types of cattle are kept even on one farm. Short Horn, Hereford, Friesian and Charolais are among the most popular breeds. Sheep are also bred mainly for meat _ lamb and mutton.
